title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message:
The laptop came very slow to task, I decided to restore it, it got stocked on 1 minute remaining finalizing the restore, I waited for almost 5hrs, still remaining……. So I decided to swap the board in to another macbook for restore, it started flashing folder with question mark

pp3v3_s5_ssd -0.7v
pp1v2_ssd_hot-0v
Pp1v2_ssd_cold-0v
Pp1v8_ssd_cold-0v
Pp3v3_2v7_nand_vcc-0v
No short
Pls help

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message: Did you fix J9600 in place?

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message: Just checked it’s not in place.

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message: The metal place of Lifeboat connector MUST be in placa; if not, SSD is not available.

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message:
Thanks ssd is back. 
The response was very slow when the system came. I have put the board into another macbook body. Still very slow, then I decided to restore. Now is stucked on less than one minute remaining. And the fan is spinning very high. it wount pass that stage. 
thanks

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message:
Did PRAM reset?
Fans spin fast from start, or after 20-30s?
Battery is recognized and charging?
Any error pops up starting in diagnostic mode?

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message:
yes I did a pram reset
The fan start Speeding from recovery mode to the point of  less than a minute remaining…..
Battery has a charging sign and it’s charged to 100%
The fan sped all through the restore
still stocked at leas than a minute remaining.

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message:
Check if you can boot into Windows/Linux Live.
You may try known good BIOS, clean ME.

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message: Sorry I don’t understand the “clean ME”

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message: I have install another bios u6100. Still very laggy, dragging, slow, after klicks it wount respond immediately.

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message:
Changed the BIOS chip, or reflashed it with clean ME BIOS?

Try to respond to all recommended tests.

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message: Sorry I don’t know how to go about the clean me bios. I just replaced the bios with a known good one. Am installing Big Sur via the flash drive. Stucked at that “ less than a minute remaining and it l8ter progress a little bit after 12hrs. The progress bar was stocked at 90% progress bar. And I later discovered that the system was actually freezing, noting is responding except the fan spin, the apple logo with 90% progress bar.

title: 820-00239-A flashing folder with question mark
message:
You need to clean ME region!
Use this file for test:
